notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 102.12.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Click-jacking certificate exceptions through rendering lag (CVE-2023-34414)

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 114 and Firefox ESR 102.12 (CVE-2023-34416)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: The UI Performs the Wrong Action

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

The error page for sites with invalid TLS certificates was missing the activation-delay Firefox uses to protect prompts and permission dialogs from attacks that exploit human response time delays. If a malicious page elicited user clicks in precise locations immediately before navigating to a site with a certificate error and made the renderer extremely busy at the same time, it could create a gap between when the error page was loaded and when the display actually refreshed. With the right timing the elicited clicks could land in that gap and activate the button that overrides the certificate error for that site.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Click-jacking certificate exceptions through rendering lag
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Click-jacking certificate exceptions through rendering lag

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Mozilla developers and community members Gabriele Svelto, Andrew McCreight, the Mozilla Fuzzing Team, Sean Feng, and Sebastian Hengst reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 113 and Firefox ESR 102.11. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 114 and Firefox ESR 102.12
